alert.note: Alert for Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:23AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster and west central Dutchess Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 522 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Paltz, moving north at 30 mph. This storm continues to exhibit broad low level rotation. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fairview around 530 AM EDT. Hyde Park and High Falls around 535 AM EDT. Tillson around 540 AM EDT. Hurley and Staatsburg around 550 AM EDT. Port Ewen around 555 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Tuckers Corner, Norrie Heights, Rosendale, Maple Hill, Forest Glen, Stone Ridge, Elting Corners, Ireland Corners, Haviland and Marbletown. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
